macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Climb on Tech Optimism with Dow Up 0.6%
items.summary: Wall Street rebounded led by technology stocks after TSMC forecasted robust growth into 2026. The Dow Jones rose 0.60% to 49,442, S&P 500 added 0.26% to 6,944, and Nasdaq gained 0.25% to 23,530.

items.title: S&P 500 Inches Up 0.09% to 6951 Amid Mixed Labor Data
items.summary: The US500 rose 0.09% to 6951, with Nasdaq up 0.16% driven by Alphabet's 2.5% rally. JOLTS showed sharp drop in job openings signaling cooling labor demand, offset by ADP private hiring rebound and upside ISM Services PMI.

items.title: Resilient Labor Markets Reduce Fed Rate Cut Expectations
items.summary: US labor data showed positive signs with continuing claims dropping to 1.88 million, supporting full employment but tempering expectations for additional Fed rate cuts this year amid ticking up bond yields.

items.title: Earnings Season Kicks Off with Focus on S&P 500 Growth
items.summary: Major banks reported mixed results to start 2026 earnings, with S&P 500 companies expected to boost earnings 15%; upcoming reports from Netflix, Intel, and Magnificent 7 could drive market direction amid high valuations.

items.title: Stocks Waver Near Records with Dow Down 0.1%
items.summary: Wall Street stocks fluctuated near record highs, with S&P 500 mostly unchanged and Dow Jones falling 37 points or 0.1% midday, reflecting mixed sector performances.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Declines to $3.22T Amid Mixed Trading
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market cap fell 1.48% over the past 24 hours to $3.22T, with Bitcoin trading at $95,727 (down 1.06%) and most major cryptocurrencies showing mixed performance. Market outperformers included GLMR (up 23%), DASH (up 18%), and MET (up 16%).

items.title: U.S. Senate Unveils Long-Awaited Crypto Regulatory Framework Bill
items.summary: U.S. senators introduced draft legislation to create a comprehensive regulatory framework for cryptocurrency, clarifying financial regulators' jurisdiction over the sector. The bill addresses stablecoin regulations and decentralized finance oversight, with the Senate Banking Committee scheduled to debate it on Thursday.

items.title: Belgium's KBC Group to Launch Bitcoin and Ethereum Trading Services
items.summary: Belgium's major banking group KBC announced plans to launch Bitcoin and Ethereum trading services, marking institutional adoption of cryptocurrency trading platforms.

items.title: CME Group Expands Crypto Derivatives with Cardano, Chainlink, and Stellar Futures
items.summary: CME Group announced the launch of futures contracts for Cardano, Chainlink, and Stellar, expanding regulated cryptocurrency derivatives offerings for institutional investors.

items.title: X Bans InfoFi 'Post-to-Earn' Apps, Triggering Sector-Wide Selloff
items.summary: X's ban on InfoFi 'Post-to-Earn' applications triggered a sector-wide selloff, with KAITO dropping 20% in response to the platform's policy change.

items.title: Ethereum Activity Doubles as New Users Flood Network
items.summary: Ethereum experienced a significant surge in network activity with new users flooding the platform, according to Glassnode data analysis.

items.title: Jefferies Removes Bitcoin from Asia Portfolio Over Quantum Computing Concerns
items.summary: Investment bank Jefferies removed Bitcoin from its Asia-focused portfolio, citing long-term risks from quantum computing advances that could undermine Bitcoin's cryptographic security. The move signals institutional recalibration of quantum technology progress.

items.title: Moldova Moves to Regulate Crypto Under EU-Style MiCA Framework
items.summary: Moldova announced plans to implement cryptocurrency regulation aligned with the EU's Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) framework by 2026, strengthening regulatory oversight in the region.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Cast AI Reaches Unicorn Status with Cloud Cost Optimization for AI Workloads
items.summary: Cast AI achieved unicorn valuation following a new funding round, fueled by demand for its platform that automates cloud cost optimization for Kubernetes and AI workloads by right-sizing clusters and scheduling jobs.

items.title: Clari Labs Research: 87% of Enterprises Missed Revenue Targets Despite AI Investments
items.summary: New research from Clari Labs reveals 87% of enterprises missed major revenue targets in 2025 due to fragmented data and siloed systems, despite heavy AI spending on forecasting tools.

items.title: Cognizant Report: AI Could Unlock $4.5 Trillion in U.S. Labor Productivity
items.summary: Cognizant's 'New Work, New World 2026' report estimates AI could add up to $4.5 trillion annually to U.S. labor productivity, but requires reskilling and responsible implementation to avoid inequality.

items.title: EMA and FDA Release Joint Principles for AI in Medicine Development
items.summary: The European Medicines Agency and U.S. FDA jointly outlined ten principles for good AI practices across the medicines lifecycle, from research to safety monitoring.

items.title: IBM Launches Sovereign Core Software for AI-Ready Digital Sovereignty
items.summary: IBM introduced Sovereign Core, the first AI-ready sovereign-enabled software allowing enterprises and governments to build and manage self-controlled AI environments amid rising regulatory demands.

items.title: UK AI Security Institute Releases Frontier AI Trends Report
items.summary: The UK AI Security Institute published its Frontier AI Trends Report, highlighting key developments in advanced AI systems.

items.title: Anthropic Advances Claude for Healthcare and Life Sciences
items.summary: Anthropic announced advancements in Claude AI tailored for healthcare and life sciences research applications.

items.title: OpenAI Introduces ChatGPT Health
items.summary: OpenAI launched ChatGPT Health, a new tool designed for health and life sciences research.

items.title: Teradata Completes 150+ Enterprise AI Engagements in 2025
items.summary: Teradata reported over 150 AI customer engagements in 2025 across sectors like finance and healthcare, using its AI platform for applications including AML models and medical imaging.

items.title: Contactless AI Sensor Detects Irregular Heart Rhythms
items.summary: Scientists developed a radar-like sensor using radio waves and AI to detect atrial fibrillation without body contact, published in Nature Communications.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Arcade Archives Series Hits 500 Titles with Space Invaders Release
items.summary: HAMSTER Corporation's Arcade Archives reached its 500th title with Space Invaders on December 25, 2025, emphasizing preservation of arcade classics through detailed recreations, authentic sounds, and new modes like Caravan on Xbox and other platforms.[1]

items.title: Arc Raiders Sells 12 Million Copies in Under Three Months
items.summary: The game Arc Raiders has achieved massive commercial success, selling 12 million copies shortly after launch, highlighting strong player demand amid industry challenges.[2]

items.title: KRAFTON Restructures for Stronger Game Development Pipeline
items.summary: KRAFTON announced a strategic shift on January 16, 2026, to boost first-party production, adopt early-validation models, scale franchises, and formalize India publishing via KIGI for long-term growth.[3]

items.title: Italy Launches Investigations into Activision Blizzard Over In-Game Purchases
items.summary: Italy's competition regulator is probing Microsoft-owned Activision Blizzard for misleading sales practices in Diablo Immortal and Call of Duty Mobile, targeting addictive designs, poor parental controls, and privacy issues affecting minors.[4]

items.title: Meta Closes Three VR Studios in Latest Layoffs
items.summary: Meta shut down multiple VR studios as part of broader Reality Labs layoffs, impacting around 10% of employees in its gaming divisions.[2]

items.title: Ubisoft Faces Layoffs and Union Complaints After Halifax Studio Closure
items.summary: Ubisoft continues layoffs with 55 staff cuts at Massive and Stockholm studios; unions file complaints over the Halifax closure, criticizing lack of support for affected workers.[2]

items.title: Pokemon Legends Z-A Mega Dimension DLC Released with Mixed Reception
items.summary: The Mega Dimension DLC for Pokemon Legends Z-A launched two months post-release, adding new Mega Evolutions and story content but criticized for heavy RNG elements frustrating completionists.[5]

items.title: Bobby Kotick Claims Lawsuit Aimed to Aid Embracer Group
items.summary: Former Activision CEO Bobby Kotick rebutted a lawsuit opposing the Microsoft deal, alleging it secretly benefited Embracer Group, which denies involvement.[2]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Trump Pushes Emergency Electricity Auction to Make Tech Firms Pay for Surging Power Costs
items.summary: President Trump is advocating for an emergency wholesale electricity auction to compel tech companies to fund new power plants amid rising demand. US equity futures are rising on tech enthusiasm, with memory chip makers SanDisk and Micron gaining in pre-market trading following TSMC's upbeat outlook.

items.title: Trump Calls for Temporary 10% Cap on Credit Card Interest Rates
items.summary: US President Donald Trump has called for a temporary 10% cap on credit card interest rates as part of fintech policy developments. This is highlighted among the top fintech stories of the week.

items.title: US Bancorp to Acquire BTIG in Deal Worth Up to $1 Billion
items.summary: US Bancorp announced plans to acquire BTIG in a deal valued at up to $1 billion, marking a significant fintech acquisition. The move is part of key weekly developments in the sector.

items.title: Rain Reaches $1.95 Billion Valuation with $250 Million Series C Funding
items.summary: Fintech firm Rain has achieved a $1.95 billion valuation after raising $250 million in a Series C round. This funding underscores growing investment in fintech platforms.
